gml:Point.gml:name: Tie Point in upper left corner

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Lake Water Quality: global 10-daily Offline (raster 1km) - version 1, May 2018

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString:
Monitoring water quality in lakes and reservoirs is key in maintaining safe water for drinking, bathing, fishing and agriculture and aquaculture activities. Long-term trends and short-term changes are indicators of environmental health and changes in the water catchment area. Directives such as the EU's Water Framework Directive or the US EPA Clean Water Act request information about the ecological status of all lakes larger than 50 ha. Satellite monitoring helps to systematically cover a large number of lakes and reservoirs, reducing needs for monitoring infrastructure (e.g. vessels) and efforts.
The Lake Water Quality products provide a semi-continuous observation record for a large number of medium and large-sized lakes, according to the Global Lakes and Wetlands Database (GLWD) or otherwise of specific environmental monitoring interest.
They consist of three water quality parameters: (i) the turbidity of a lake, that describes water clarity or whether sunlight can penetrate deeper parts of the lake. Turbidity often varies seasonally, both with the discharge of rivers and growth of phytoplankton; (ii) the trophic state index that is an indicator of the productivity of a lake in terms of phytoplankton, and indirectly, over longer time scales, reflects the eutrophication status of a water body and (iii) the lake surface reflectances that describe the apparent colour of the water body and are intended for scientific users interested in further development of algorithms. The visual reflectance bands can also be combined into true-colour images.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: This product is part of the Global Land component of the Copernicus Land Service

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: Lake Surface Reflectance, Turbidity and Trophic State Index were produced by the Plymouth Marine Laboratory and Brockmann Consult for the Copernicus Global Land Operations Service under Copernicus Global Land Operations Lot 2

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: They enable our customers to better understand and manage our natural environment, and to mitigate environmental threats.
Plymouth Marine Laboratory is a charity, undertaking pioneering marine research for the benefit of us all.

gmd:fileDescription.gco:CharacterString: Lake Water Quality in Lake Turkana

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: (d) the confidentiality of commercial or industrial information, where such confidentiality is provided for by national or Community law to protect a legitimate economic interest, including the public interest in maintaining statistical confidentiality and tax secrecy.

gmd:fees.gco:CharacterString: Free by ftp and EUMETCast; cost of medium by DvD or tape

gmd:orderingInstructions.gco:CharacterString: Products can be downloaded online via HTTP (or FTP) or can be received through EUMETCast satellite reception in Europe, Africa and Latin-America. When ordering products from the online archive or subscribing to receive future products, users are informed via e-mail whenever the requested products are ready to be downloaded on the FTP server.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: 1. Search, download and custom order products from Catalogue and Ordering services
2. Subscribe to receive future products via e-mail
3. Register to receive products via EUMETCast

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: The input data are the 9 days, 0:00:00 Top measured by the MERIS sensor.
